verses.verse: And God <WH430> remembered <WH2142> Noah <WH5146>, and every living thing <WH2416>, and all the cattle <WH929> that was with him in the ark <WH8392>: and God <WH430> made <WH5674> a wind <WH7307> to pass <WH5674> over <WH5921> the earth <WH776>, and the waters <WH4325> subsided <WH7918>;
The fountains <WH4599> also of the deep <WH8415> and the windows <WH699> of heaven <WH8064> were stopped <WH5534>, and the rain <WH1653> from heaven <WH8064> was restrained <WH3607>;

And the waters <WH4325> returned <WH7725> from off the earth <WH776> continually <WH1980>: and after the end <WH7097> of the hundred <WH3967> and fifty <WH2572> days <WH3117> the waters <WH4325> decreased <WH2637>.
And the ark <WH8392> rested <WH5117> in the seventh <WH7637> month <WH2320>, on the seventeenth <WH6240> day <WH3117> of the month <WH2320>, upon the mountains <WH2022> of Ararat <WH780>.

And the waters <WH4325> decreased <WH2637> continually <WH1980> until <WH5704> the tenth <WH6224> month <WH2320>: in the tenth <WH6224> month <WH259>, on the first day of the month <WH2320>, were the tops <WH7218> of the mountains <WH2022> seen <WH7200>.
And it came to pass at the end <WH7093> of forty <WH705> days <WH3117>, that Noah <WH5146> opened <WH6605> the window <WH2474> of the ark <WH8392> which he had made <WH6213>:
And he sent forth <WH7971> a raven <WH6158>, which went out <WH3318>, back <WH3318> and forth <WH7725>, until the waters <WH4325> were dried up <WH3001> from off the earth <WH776>.
Also he sent forth <WH7971> a dove <WH3123> from him <WH7200>, to see if the waters <WH4325> were gone <WH7043> from off the face <WH6440> of the ground <WH127>;

But the dove <WH3123> found <WH4672> no rest <WH4494> for the sole <WH3709> of her foot <WH7272>, and she returned <WH7725> to him into the ark <WH8392>, for the waters <WH4325> were on the face <WH6440> of the whole earth <WH776>: then he put forth <WH7971> his hand <WH3027>, and took her <WH3947>, and pulled her in <WH935> unto him into the ark <WH8392>.
And he stayed <WH2342> yet another <WH312> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>; and again <WH3254> he sent forth <WH7971> the dove <WH3123> out of the ark <WH8392>;

And the dove <WH3123> came in <WH935> to him in the evening <WH6256>; and <WH6310>, behold, in her mouth was an olive <WH2132> leaf <WH5929> plucked off <WH2965>: so Noah <WH5146> knew <WH3045> that the waters <WH4325> were gone <WH7043> from off the earth <WH776>.
And he stayed <WH3176> yet another <WH312> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>; and sent forth <WH7971> the dove <WH3123>; which returned <WH7725> not again <WH3254> unto him any more <WH5750>.

And it came to pass in the six <WH8337> hundredth <WH3967> and first year <WH8141>, in the first <WH7223> month <WH259>, the first day of the month <WH2320>, the waters <WH4325> were dried up <WH2717> from off the earth <WH776>: and Noah <WH5146> removed <WH5493> the covering <WH4372> of the ark <WH8392>, and looked <WH7200>, and <WH6440>, behold, the face of the ground <WH127> was dry <WH2717>.
And in the second <WH8145> month <WH2320>, on the seven <WH7651> and twentieth <WH6242> day <WH3117> of the month <WH2320>, was the earth <WH776> dry <WH3001>.
And God <WH430> spoke <WH1696> unto Noah <WH5146>, saying <WH559>,
Go forth <WH3318> of the ark <WH8392>, you <WH802>, and your wife, and your sons <WH1121>, and your sons <WH1121>' wives with you <WH802>.

Bring forth <WH3318> with you every living thing <WH2416> that is with you <WH1320>, of all flesh, both of bird <WH5775>, and of cattle <WH929>, and of every creeping thing <WH7431> that creeps <WH7430> upon the earth <WH776>; that they may breed abundantly <WH8317> in the earth <WH776>, and be fruitful <WH6509>, and multiply <WH7235> upon the earth <WH776>.
And Noah <WH5146> went forth <WH3318>, and his sons <WH1121>, and his wife <WH802>, and his sons <WH1121>' wives with him <WH802>:

Every beast <WH2416>, every creeping thing <WH7431>, and every bird <WH5775>, and whatever <WH3605> creeps <WH7430> upon the earth <WH776>, after their kinds <WH4940>, went forth <WH3318> out of the ark <WH8392>.

And Noah <WH5146> built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> unto the Lord <WH3068>; and took <WH3947> of every clean <WH2889> beast <WH929>, and of every clean <WH2889> bird <WH5775>, and offered <WH5927> burnt offerings <WH5930> on the altar <WH4196>.

And the Lord <WH3068> smelled <WH7306> a sweet <WH5207> savour <WH7381>; and the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> in <WH413> his heart <WH3820>, I will not again <WH3254> curse <WH7043> the ground <WH127> any more for man <WH120>'s sake <WH5668>; for the imagination <WH3336> of man <WH120>'s heart <WH3820> is evil <WH7451> from his youth <WH5271>; neither will I again <WH3254> kill <WH5221> any more every thing living <WH2416>, as I have done <WH6213>.

While the earth <WH776> remains <WH3117>, seedtime <WH2233> and harvest <WH7105>, and cold <WH7120> and heat <WH2527>, and summer <WH7019> and winter <WH2779>, and day <WH3117> and night <WH3915> shall not cease <WH7673>.
